description: Taiwan International Science Fair (TISF) was a *science research competition* for high school students from grades nine through twelve. With the mission of identifying and nurturing talented young scientists, TISF brings together around 250 domestic finalists and 40 overseas students from 20 nations to compete for awards. My project, "Investigating Novel Methods to Reduce Cholesterol Levels", managed to clinch the third prize for this international competition.
name: TISF

description: HTX Investigators' Challenge (HTXIC) was a *Capture-The-Flag competition* organised by Home Team Science and Technology Agency that challenged participants to crack problems on Internet of Things, Web Security, Operating Systems, and miscellaneous Cybersecurity concepts. My Team, team VMP, clinched 3rd Runner Up in this competition.
name: HTXIC

description: The NUS Data Analytics Competition (DAC) is an annual event hosted by the NUS Statistics & Data Science Society (NUSSDS). In its 2022 iteration, the competition was organised in a *data analytics-based format*, and participants were tasked to work with a geospatial dataset graciously sponsored by Grab. My team, Team VMP, clinched 1st place in this competition.
name: NUS DAC

description: The High Performance Computing Innovation Challenge 2022 was a competition providing participants with *High Performance Computing resources to tackle various challenge statements* on urban planning and environmental sustainability. My team, Team Viridis, developed a numerical assessment tool for analysing the walkability and bikeability of streets, using image segmentation (DeepLab V3+), data scraping techniques, various regression models (ANN, RFR, KNN etc. with Tensorflow) trained on the ASPIRE 1 supercomputer. Team Viridis clinched 1st place in this competition.
name: HPCIC

description: Cyber League 2022 was a *cybersecurity-based capture-the-flag series of competitions* aimed at building a thriving community of students and professionals to develop expertise in cybersecurity. My team, Team VMP, emerged as 1st Runner Up for the league series.
name: Cyber League

description: TezAsia Hackathon 2022 was organised with the goal of increasing accessibility of the Tezos blockchain to the general public, attracting over 11,000 participants in the process from all over the world. My team, Team VMP, developed an *NFT Marketplace* for users to mint and view 3D panoramic NFTs on the Tezos blockchain, incorporating full-stack web development (React, Express etc.), blockchain (SmartPy etc.) and machine learning technologies. Team VMP clinched 1st Runner Up in this competition.
name: Tezasia Hackathon
